intro: Gymnosporia confertiflora, commonly known as the denseflower burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dry fruits called follicles, which contain the seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Gymnosporia confertiflora is adapted to withstand drought and has a low-growing habit to reduce water loss.
